name: The Donatello Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for only one night, but will be staying here on my next trip to San Francisco. The staff was very friendly. Chuck the concierge was very knowledgable on the area and can help with setting up wine tours, restaurant reservations and more. He actually recommended a great chinese restaurant that delivers ( Was too tired from walking around all day). No need to rent a car. Fisherman's Wharf is only a $10 cab ride (actually $9.40 to and $8.40 back). Union Sq. is 1 block away, China Town 5 blocks. Also take advantage of the daily happy hour at the bar. My girl and I had 6 beers and 2 appetizers for less that $40 with tip.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — a bigger tv would be nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can't say enough wonderful things about this fabulous hotel. We are Shell Vacation club members and booked our stay through their reservation service. The hotel is one or two blocks away from everything: Union Square, cable cars, public transit, shopping, fine dining and family restaurants, We had a car and used their valet service. We never waited more than a few minutes for our car and everyone was helpful with directions. My husband, our 17-year old daughter and I were very comfortable in our large room with king-sized bed and pull out queen sofa. The staff were the best, from the reception desk to the concierge and bell service. Free coffee, tea and hot chocalate were much appreciated in the top-level lounge, along with the wonderful view! We will absolutely return to the Donatello on our next trip West.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel!!

likes.liked: — Very spacious and filled with amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The donatello was a great hotel right in the heart of San Francisco, just a block from Union square, and 3 blocks from the very busy Powell street public transportation stop that includes BART, Muni, Cabel Cable Cars, and the F-line stop. The hotel is a small boutique with the service of a 4 star hotel. My wife and I were traveling on our honeymoon, and when I made our reservation, I informed the staff of this. Upon our arrival, our room included a bottle of Champagne, a box of chocolates, and a hand written note congradulating us.
reviews.title: Great stay 1 big downfall

likes.liked: — Huge room with patio, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are HUGE compared to other rooms in downtown St. Louis. They include a huge bed, sitting area with a pull-out couch, microwave and mini fridge, along with dishes and a wet bar. The bathroom was a normal hotel bathroom. IF YOU STAY HERE, be sure to request a room on the 5th FLOOR WITH A PATIO. half of the rooms on the 5th floor open up on to a semi private patio with a table and chairs. There is no extra charge and they are more than willing to accomadate if you ask. These rooms are also a little bigger than others. The patio was a nice touch. The staff was very friendly and helped us get around the city. The one BIG downfall was the breakfast. Breakfast was a pastry and a glass of orange juice and it cost $4 per person (IT WASN"T EVEN INCLUDED IN THE HOTEL PRICE). That's a big negative, but it is not enough to ruin this great hotel with great rooms and wonderful service.
reviews.title: Only bad thing was the low showerhead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights over 4th of July weekend on vacation. Great location! Friendly staff. Big clean rooms. The only possible negative point was that the shower heads were about 5 ft. high. But even that is stretching. I highly recommend this hotel. Would definitely stay here again when I visit SF.
reviews.title: Great Value, but Some Problems

likes.disliked: — Late Night Desk Staff, Lack of Attention to Detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good hotel, clean and spacious room, friendly staff and really great location.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — Breakfast room - too small for such a big hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in San Francisco at the tail end of a trip through California, Arizona and Nevada. We booked a triple room for me, my husband and 15 year old son and we weren't disappointed by the size of our room, which included a massive queen size bed and a comfortable sofa bed and still had loads of room to spare. The room includes a "kitchen area", which has a microwave, fridge, sink and coffee maker, which was a great addition as we were pretty fed up of eating in restaurants by then. The location is good, just a block from Union Square and a cable car stop. We didn't use the leisure facilities on the Club Floor, although we were given a guided tour by the very friendly staff on duty and it looked fine. The breakfast was basic and limited, but it was complimentary, so no complaints!
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: In general, the staff throughout the hotel were helpful and friendly, which seems to be the norm in San Francisco. We loved it and would definitely make a return trip.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. The cost of the stay was the same using various websites or the hotel's own site and cost $100 for a large room as we were travelling with our teenage daughter. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, including the night staff as we arrived very late after a flight from the UK. The hotel is just a few minutes from Union Square and close a variety of transport links around the city, including the cable car.
reviews.title: ~ È bello!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast was included with the price and there was a good selection of breads and pastries. However, if I were to have one complaint it would be that the breakfast room is very small and each morning there were not enough places for people to sit and eat. Many people just picked some things up and took it to their rooms. The coffee was also not always very hot. That being said, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again if we visit San Francisco again.
reviews.title: Comfy Stay and Great Staff

likes.liked: — Great staff and nicely appointed rooms.
likes.disliked: — Shower was like being sprayed with a fire hose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Wow-just got back from San. Fran. The Donatello is casual chic-great digs for the bucks! Helpful staff, great location, rooms are loaded! No problems here-it's all good! Enjoy your stay! :- )
reviews.title: Excellent Digs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in San Fran on Business and stayed at The Westin St. Francis for 4 days. Then I moved to the Donatello to save some money for an extended vacation. All I have to Say is that the Donatello had much larger rooms and more accomidating than the St. Francis. The locations is GREAT, rooms are a bit older but VERY nice, large, includes a kitchennette, hot tub on top floor, and staff is always friendly. I didn't eat at the hotel but the bar was nice. Plus if you
reviews.title: Very nice reasonable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: need to rent a car for a napa vacation, 3 or 4 rental companies are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Location, comfortable room

likes.disliked: — Lack of internet access and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I have stayed in San Fran at least a dozen times over the last 10 years and this is the best value for the dollar.
reviews.title: Genuinely impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Donatello from 6th to 10th June.
reviews.title: loved the Donatello

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay. The bed was good, the room was clean, the shower was nice and strong, and the decor was really cool. The location for site seeing was great, especially if you're into Union Square and Chinatown. The address should really be on Mason Street as the valet car drop off is not on Post. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We were greeted warmly and when we asked for a remote for the DVD player, there was someone at our door with the remote within minutes. Good free wireless internet. The view isn't much, but that would be expected as this part of town has many high rises. The only weakness they have is in the quality of their continental breakfast...which consisted mainly of bagels and pastries. But there was a large selection of tea and coffee and hot chocolate...so, hey...whatever.
reviews.title: Great Decor, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We really liked it.
reviews.title: Classy Boutique Hotel in San Fran.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Francisco was the last stage of our trip to California and we stayed at The Donatello from 19th to 24th April 2008. We chose it after studying many hotel reviews and were well pleased with our choice. The hotel has been refurbished in contemporary style. Our room was huge by city standards. We had a microwave, sink unit and tea making facilities. There was also a CD/DVD player and Hi-Fi system. Noise was minimal. The only loudness was the orange colour of the room decor ! A simple continental breakfast of bagels and croissants with preserves was served in the beautifully furnished 'club room' on the top floor. Being close to Market Street and the cable cars for transport and Union Square for dining proved to be big plus points for this hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again and recommend it to my friends.
reviews.title: Confort in SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice hotel placed a couple of blocks from Union Square. The room are big with microwave, coffe machine, toaster and refrigerator.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We recomend it.
reviews.title: Largest Rooms in SF

likes.disliked: — Wondered about consistency. Time will tell!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our time here--the central location cannot be beat. One block from the cable car line, and walking distance to tons of restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: A great stay, fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not notice much noise like other reviews mentioned, exept on Saturday night. Quite a few revelers in town for the Memorial Day weekend.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the center of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the free internet booth was a nice extra. The only disappointment was the remodeling of the jacuzzi which made it unavailable, but the beds were very comfortable and we had lots of space in our room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with excellent service

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, comfortable beds, roof terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 3rd trip to San Francisco, but our first stay at The Donatello.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

likes.liked: — Excellent service, many free amenities other hotels charge for, location, cleanliness
likes.disliked: — small fitness center, felt SLIGHT attempts at sales pitch for timeshare, but nothing overbearing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on 05/21/08 & 05/22/08. We had a room on the 9th floor. The hotel staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room was very clean. The comforter on the bed was probably the heaviest one I have ever found in a hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Glenn the Concierge was great! He planned our whole trip from beginning to end for us hour by hour, dining, theater, sightseeing, everything. It felt as if we saw everything San Francisco had to offer yet still had time to enjoy our vacation. The house keeping was particularly friendly aspecially Thelma and Damaris. Jesus at the front desk always had a witty one-liner which kept my wife and I laughing. To make a long story short, it was the friendly service that goes abouve and beyond that makes The Donatello the best place in Union Square to visit.
reviews.title: Great Service!! We'll be back!!

likes.liked: — The staff and concierge are the best part about the Hotel
likes.disliked: — Hot tub was not in service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was Great, just don't book your tours through the concierge. We booked one that included Muir Woods and the Wine country. The concierge or hotel uses a tour company called Extranomical Adventusan Fransico. They sent an 8 passenger van and put 15 people in it. It was so bad, we had to get off and not take the tour. The tour company said no refunds because you have to cancel 72 hours in advance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel ... Bad Tour experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super hotel. Biggest beds and great sized rooms. Really convenient - just a block from Union Square and bars/eateries.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Check the hotel website for their Sunday night special. (The closer to the weekend, the lower the price gets as long as they have rooms.) We had a King Suite: King bed (very comfortable), sitting area (couch, chair), entertainment center and wet bar (sink, refrigerator, microwave,coffee maker, real cups and glasses, silverware...) Noise was NOT a problem on Sunday night. Very pleasant and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great Location. Great Price.

likes.liked: — Comfort, class, quality & location - especially for the price.

reviews.title: dont take a room over looking Post or Mason
reviews.text: Great location; Easy walking distance to Union Square, Curran Theatre, trolley & more - try Max's restaurant a short block away - more reasonable than the hotel's restaurant and great food (breakfast, lunch and dinner.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: If the hotel could find a way to sound proof the windows this would resolve the noise issue. Second night (Saturday I slept with the pillow over by head which helped) so if you are a light sleeper like me do not take a room over looking this street ask to be moved right a way.
reviews.title: Wonderful amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the only issue we had, we didnt change rooms as we where only there for 3 nights in total, but now that we know this side of the hotel is loud, we will make sure not to take a room on this side of the street!
reviews.title: Best Hotel of all I've visited

likes.liked: — Free wireless internet, comfortable bed, housekeeping, balcony
likes.disliked: — Recommeded me to a horrible restaurant (can't remember name now)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great location to everything will be posting a travel tip in the near future
reviews.title: Too noisy for rooms facing street, specially on week-ends

likes.disliked: — The noise of the rooms facing the street and the lack of space in breakfast area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Donatello is great! The location is perfect, just enough off the beaten path to feel relaxed once you walk away from Market Street crowds. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. I love the little kitchenette and the empty fridge. It even had a microwave and toaster in the room, plus plates and glasses. There was a DVD player that was easy to use. The windows had shutters and could be opened. The thermostat worked. I loved the color scheme with the orange wall. The bed and pillows were comfortable. I thought it was an incredible value worth far more than I paid.
reviews.title: Greatest Stay!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Got a great rate on rooms at the Donatello when in town for a conference. The rooms are large, clean, and decorated nicely. Bed was great and there is even free wireless internet.
reviews.title: Clean and large rooms, nice decor, and good location. noisy though!
This place should be 5 stars!
reviews.text: My only complaint is every morning I could not sleep past 8 AM because there was always car noise from the street. Lots of horns honking that were impossible to sleep through. Other than that, great hotel that I would consider staying at again. Just try to get a room that is away from the street noise. (not sure if possible)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 1 night here at this hotel on Saturday, May 3, and I wish I would have had at least 5 more! After reading the awesome reviews on Trip Advisor, I was able to secure a room through their website for $139/night with valet parking included! Very reasonable. We drove up Saturday morning from Monterey, CA to see Spiderman 3 on the IMAX at the Metreon and to go to the nightclub Ruby Skye. We couln't have picked a better location. Period. Upon our arrival, the bellhop was curteous and very patient as I unloaded ALL the crap I had brought for my 1 night stay (you know how many shoes women like to bring!). Mark, the front desk man, was extremely nice. When I entered our hotel room, I was astonished at the size of the room! If you've visited San Francisco, then you are aware that most normal hotel rooms are pretty tiny. This room had to be around 400 sq. feet! It was very modernly designed and the comforter on the bed was one of the softest I have slept under. We hadn't been in our room more than 10 minutes when there was a knock at the door and the maid was there to give us our complimentary bath robes. The concierge also called to say she was sorry she had missed us when we checked in, and to come down for our free maps of San Francisco (which had an AWESOME map of all the shopping places). Talk about great service! I've visited 5 star hotels and not been paid attention to this much. They have a jacuzzi, and men/women dry saunas as well as a fitness club. I didn't get a chance to visit their restaurant Zingari, but it looked very nice.
reviews.title: Perfect stay
Donatello Hotel
reviews.text: The biggest WOW for me was when my husband and I opened the curtains to check out our view and TADA! Ruby Skye was DIRECTLY in front of us. We could literally CRAWL home from the club if we needed to. ;) So instead of showing up at the club at 10pm to avoid the line, and then waiting until 1am for the headlining DJ to come on, we were able to drink our alcoholic beverages in our room and peek out the window every 15 minutes or so to make sure the line wasn't getting too long. It was so great! For all you Ruby Skye visitors, we were in room 601.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Donatello is located right in the heart of Union Square and we didn't have to walk for more than 5 minutes to get to all the shopping. I think I have found the hotel that I will stay at almost every time I want to visit San Fran. We were just so surprised and SO pleased. You rock Donatello. Plain and simple.
reviews.title: Excellent experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel! Very clean, large room, EXTREMELY friendly and helpful staff. Is in the heart of it all in Union Square just a block from the cable cars and a few blocks from great shopping. Being in the heart of it all does make for a little more street noise than usual but nothing dramatic. Good continental breakfast of pastries and coffees in the rooftop club room. We had a great rate including parking and breakfast from hotelres.com. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Donatello is a very pleasant hotel located right off Union Square in San Francisco. We found the service to be very good, the room simple but reasonably well appointed.
reviews.title: Good hotel at reasonable price for central San Fancisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was great, they who we were and we got checked-in in about 1 minute flat. The rooms are pretty big (we had a double aspect corner room on 6th floor on the Corner of Mason and Post St, I think). They have all facilities (including basic kitchen facilities), and a sofa, safe, free wifi, etc.
reviews.title: What a great surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom in our room was a bit basic - the decor was not brilliant but it was useable and pretty clean.
reviews.title: Very Nice Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: Being in a city centre it was not a quiet place to stay, there were sirens, people partying (out on the street) and trucks and vehicles all night - the windows were not very well soundproofed at all and our sleep was occasionally disturbed a bit by this.
reviews.title: Loved The Donatello

likes.liked: — Friendly, helpful staff and great location

description: Located in the heart of San Francisco's fashionable shopping and theater district by Union Square is the spacious Donatello. Settle into tastefully appointed rooms and enjoy the top floor fitness center, with a whirlpool spa and private saunas, which provides the perfect retreat after a day exploring the city. You can take a cable car up and down San Francisco 's colorful neighborhoods or explore the many streets of Chinatown. And when you work up an appetite in a city know for its cuisine, the Zingari Ristorante, located onsite, is a Northern Italian feast for the taste buds. Fully experience fine dining, theater and shopping in San Francisco at our luxurious retreat in the exciting City by the Bay-a San Francisco getaway perfect for romance, leisure and business travel.
